briefdescription.para: Get the detected color hue.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Hue has a range of 0 to 359.999

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: hue value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color saturation.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Saturation has a range of 0 to 1.0

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: saturation value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color brightness.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Brightness has a range of 0 to 1.0

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: brightness value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected proximity value.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. proximity has a range of 0 to 255.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: poximity value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Set the pwm value of the White LED.

detaileddescription.para: value that ranges from 0 to 100

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation is successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the pwm value of the White LED.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: LED pwm value that ranges from 0 to 100 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the processed RGBC data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: rgb value if the operation was successful or an optical_rgb_s_t with all fields set to PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the raw, unprocessed RGBC data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: raw rgb value if the operation was successful or an optical_raw_s_t with all fields set to PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the most recent gesture data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: Gestures will be cleared after 500mS

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: gesture value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the most recent raw gesture data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: gesture value if the operation was successful or an optical_gesture_s_t with all fields set to PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Enable gesture detection on the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation is successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Disable gesture detection on the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation is successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of milliseconds since PROS initialized.

simplesect.para: The number of milliseconds since PROS initialized

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of microseconds since PROS initialized,.

simplesect.para: The number of microseconds since PROS initialized

memberdef.argsstring: (task_fn_t function, void *const parameters, uint32_t prio, const uint16_t stack_depth, const char *const name)
memberdef.name: task_create

briefdescription.para: Creates a new task and add it to the list of tasks that are ready to run.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENOMEM - The stack cannot be used as the TCB was not created.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the task entry function

Pointer to memory that will be used as a parameter for the task being created. This memory should not typically come from stack, but rather from dynamically (i.e., malloc'd) or statically allocated memory.
The priority at which the task should run. TASK_PRIO_DEFAULT plus/minus 1 or 2 is typically used.
The number of words (i.e. 4 * stack_depth) available on the task's stack. TASK_STACK_DEPTH_DEFAULT is typically sufficienct.
A descriptive name for the task. This is mainly used to facilitate debugging. The name may be up to 32 characters long.

simplesect.para: A handle by which the newly created task can be referenced. If an error occurred, NULL will be returned and errno can be checked for hints as to why task_create failed.

briefdescription.para: Removes a task from the RTOS real time kernel's management.

detaileddescription.para: The task being deleted will be removed from all ready, blocked, suspended and event lists.
Memory dynamically allocated by the task is not automatically freed, and should be freed before the task is deleted.

parameterdescription.para: The handle of the task to be deleted. Passing NULL will cause the calling task to be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Delays a task for a given number of milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: This is not the best method to have a task execute code at predefined intervals, as the delay time is measured from when the delay is requested. To delay cyclically, use task_delay_until().

parameterdescription.para: The number of milliseconds to wait (1000 milliseconds per second)

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of milliseconds since PROS initialized.

simplesect.para: The number of milliseconds since PROS initialized

briefdescription.para: Delays a task until a specified time.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be used by periodic tasks to ensure a constant execution frequency.
The task will be woken up at the time *prev_time + delta, and *prev_time will be updated to reflect the time at which the task will unblock.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the location storing the setpoint time. This should typically be initialized to the return value of millis().
The number of milliseconds to wait (1000 milliseconds per second)

briefdescription.para: Gets the priority of the specified task.

parameterdescription.para: The task to check

simplesect.para: The priority of the task

briefdescription.para: Sets the priority of the specified task.

detaileddescription.para: If the specified task's state is available to be scheduled (e.g. not blocked) and new priority is higher than the currently running task, a context switch may occur.

parameterdescription.para: The task to set
The new priority of the task

briefdescription.para: Gets the state of the specified task.

parameterdescription.para: The task to check

simplesect.para: The state of the task

briefdescription.para: Suspends the specified task, making it ineligible to be scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: The task to suspend

briefdescription.para: Resumes the specified task, making it eligible to be scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: The task to resume

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of tasks the kernel is currently managing, including all ready, blocked, or suspended tasks.

detaileddescription.para: A task that has been deleted, but not yet reaped by the idle task will also be included in the count. Tasks recently created may take one context switch to be counted.

simplesect.para: The number of tasks that are currently being managed by the kernel.

briefdescription.para: Gets the name of the specified task.

parameterdescription.para: The task to check

simplesect.para: A pointer to the name of the task

briefdescription.para: Gets a task handle from the specified name.

detaileddescription.para: The operation takes a relatively long time and should be used sparingly.

parameterdescription.para: The name to query

simplesect.para: A task handle with a matching name, or NULL if none were found.

briefdescription.para: Get the currently running task handle.

detaileddescription.para: This could be useful if a task wants to tell another task about itself.

simplesect.para: The currently running task handle.

briefdescription.para: Sends a simple notification to task and increments the notification counter.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The task to notify

simplesect.para: Always returns true.

briefdescription.para: Utilizes task notifications to wait until specified task is complete and deleted, then continues to execute the program.

detaileddescription.para: Analogous to std::thread::join in C++.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The handle of the task to wait on.

simplesect.para: void

memberdef.argsstring: (task_t task, uint32_t value, notify_action_e_t action, uint32_t *prev_value)
memberdef.name: task_notify_ext

briefdescription.para: Sends a notification to a task, optionally performing some action.

detaileddescription.para: Will also retrieve the value of the notification in the target task before modifying the notification value.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The task to notify
The value used in performing the action
An action to optionally perform on the receiving task's notification value
A pointer to store the previous value of the target task's notification, may be NULL

simplesect.para: Dependent on the notification action. For NOTIFY_ACTION_NO_WRITE: return 0 if the value could be written without needing to overwrite, 1 otherwise. For all other NOTIFY_ACTION values: always return 0

briefdescription.para: Waits for a notification to be nonzero.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: If true (1), then the notification value is cleared. If false (0), then the notification value is decremented.
Specifies the amount of time to be spent waiting for a notification to occur.

simplesect.para: The value of the task's notification value before it is decremented or cleared

briefdescription.para: Clears the notification for a task.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The task to clear

simplesect.para: False if there was not a notification waiting, true if there was

briefdescription.para: Creates a mutex.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/multitasking.html#mutexes for details.

simplesect.para: A handle to a newly created mutex. If an error occurred, NULL will be returned and errno can be checked for hints as to why mutex_create failed.

briefdescription.para: Takes and locks a mutex, waiting for up to a certain number of milliseconds before timing out.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/multitasking.html#mutexes for details.

parameterdescription.para: Mutex to attempt to lock.
Time to wait before the mutex becomes available. A timeout of 0 can be used to poll the mutex. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the mutex was successfully taken, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the the mutex couldn't be taken.

briefdescription.para: Unlocks a mutex.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/multitasking.html#mutexes for details.

parameterdescription.para: Mutex to unlock.

simplesect.para: True if the mutex was successfully returned, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the mutex couldn't be returned.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a mutex.

parameterdescription.para: Mutex to unlock.

briefdescription.para: Clears the vision sensor LED color, reseting it back to its default behavior, displaying the most prominent object signature color.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int32_t id, const int32_t u_min, const int32_t u_max, const int32_t u_mean, const int32_t v_min, const int32_t v_max, const int32_t v_mean, const float range, const int32_t type)
memberdef.name: vision_signature_from_utility

briefdescription.para: Creates a signature from the vision sensor utility.

parameterdescription.para: The signature ID
Minimum value on U axis
Maximum value on U axis
Mean value on U axis
Minimum value on V axis
Maximum value on V axis
Mean value on V axis
Scale factor
Signature type

simplesect.para: A vision_signature_s_t that can be set using vision_set_signature

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t sig_id1, const uint32_t sig_id2, const uint32_t sig_id3, const uint32_t sig_id4, const uint32_t sig_id5)
memberdef.name: vision_create_color_code

briefdescription.para: Creates a color code that represents a combination of the given signature IDs.

detaileddescription.para: If fewer than 5 signatures are to be a part of the color code, pass 0 for the additional function parameters.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - Fewer than two signatures have been provided or one of the signatures is out of its [1-7] range (or 0 when omitted).

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The first signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The second signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The third signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The fourth signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The fifth signature id [1-7] to add to the color code

simplesect.para: A vision_color_code_t object containing the color code information.

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects. EHOSTDOWN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given size id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const uint32_t sig_id)
memberdef.name: vision_get_by_sig

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object of the given signature according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EINVAL - sig_id is outside the range [1-8] EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects. EAGAIN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The signature ID [1-7] for which an object will be returned.

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given signature and size_id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const vision_color_code_t color_code)
memberdef.name: vision_get_by_code

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object of the given color code according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EAGAIN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The vision_color_code_t for which an object will be returned

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given color code and size_id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Gets the exposure parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/vision.html#exposure-setting for more detials.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The current exposure setting from [0,150], PROS_ERR if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of objects currently detected by the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The number of objects detected on the specified vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid or an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Get the white balance parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The current RGB white balance setting of the sensor

briefdescription.para: Prints the contents of the signature as an initializer list to the terminal.

parameterdescription.para: The signature for which the contents will be printed

simplesect.para: 1 if no errors occured, PROS_ERR otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const uint32_t object_count, vision_object_s_t *const object_arr)
memberdef.name: vision_read_by_size

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The number of objects to read
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const uint32_t sig_id, const uint32_t object_count, vision_object_s_t *const object_arr)
memberdef.name: vision_read_by_sig

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The number of objects to read
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The signature ID [1-7] for which objects will be returned.
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const vision_color_code_t color_code, const uint32_t object_count, vision_object_s_t *const object_arr)
memberdef.name: vision_read_by_code

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The number of objects to read
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The vision_color_code_t for which objects will be returned
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

briefdescription.para: Gets the object detection signature with the given id number.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The signature id to read

simplesect.para: A vision_signature_s_t containing information about the signature.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint8_t signature_id, vision_signature_s_t *const signature_ptr)
memberdef.name: vision_set_signature

briefdescription.para: Stores the supplied object detection signature onto the vision sensor.

simplesect.para: This saves the signature in volatile memory, and the signature will be lost as soon as the sensor is powered down.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The signature id to store into
A pointer to the signature to save

simplesect.para: 1 if no errors occured, PROS_ERR otherwise

briefdescription.para: Enables/disables auto white-balancing on the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EINVAL - enable was not 0 or 1

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
Pass 0 to disable, 1 to enable

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the exposure parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/vision.html#exposure-setting for more detials.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The new exposure setting from [0,150]

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the vision sensor LED color, overriding the automatic behavior.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
An RGB code to set the LED to

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the white balance parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The new RGB white balance setting of the sensor

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the (0,0) coordinate for the Field of View.

detaileddescription.para: This will affect the coordinates returned for each request for a vision_object_s_t from the sensor, so it is recommended that this function only be used to configure the sensor at the beginning of its use.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
One of vision_zero_e_t to set the (0,0) coordinate for the FOV

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the Wi-Fi mode of the Vision sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This functions uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given port is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21) EACCESS - Anothe resources is currently trying to access the port

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
Disable Wi-Fi on the Vision sensor if 0, enable otherwise (e.g. 1)

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: The direction indicating an upward gesture.
The direction indicating a downward gesture.
The direction indicating a rightward gesture.
The direction indicating a leftward gesture.
